rbiom
  • Reference

Provides a table of sample diversity values at multiple read depths.

A useful function for making rarefaction curve plots.

subsample(biom, x = 10, progressbar = FALSE)

Arguments

biom

A BIOM object, as returned from read.biom.
x

A numeric vector giving the depths to rarefy at. If the vector has only a length of one, the value is taken to mean the number of different depths to automatically select.
progressbar

Whether to display a progress bar and status messages (TRUE/FALSE). Will automatically tie in with shiny if run within a shiny session.

Value

A data frame with column names Sample, Depth, OTUs, Shannon, Simpson, and Chao1.

Examples

    library(rbiom)

    infile <- system.file("extdata", "hmp50.biom", package = "rbiom")
    biom <- read.biom(infile)
    rc <- subsample(biom, x=5)
    head(rc)
#>   Sample Depth OTUs  Shannon   Simpson     Chao1
#> 1  HMP01     4    4 1.386294 0.7500000       Inf
#> 2  HMP01    22   11 2.287314 0.8884298  13.00000
#> 3  HMP01   106   32 2.808329 0.9031684 132.00000
#> 4  HMP01   507   49 2.808744 0.8954791  91.66667
#> 5  HMP01  2406   88 2.972068 0.9082417 112.00000
#> 6  HMP02     4    3 1.039721 0.6250000   5.00000
